DataElement.preferredName: COST - FACIT Version 2 FT12 How True Past Seven Days Illness is Financial Hardship to My Family and Me Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of how true in the past 7 days their illness has been a financial hardship to their family and them, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: COST-FACIT How True Past Week Illness is Financial Hardship to My Family and Me Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient-reported outcome measure designed specifically to evaluate the financial distress experienced by cancer patients._A question about an individual's agreement with a statement._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about whether an individualÂ’s illness is or was a financial hardship for them and their family._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: Illness is Financial Hardship for My Family and Me
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual's illness is or was a financial hardship for them and their family.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: COST-FACIT:Comprehensive Score for Financial Toxicity-Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy, A FACIT Measure of Financial Toxicity, David Cella, Ph.D., FACIT and The University of Chicago, 21 October 2014.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for ECOG request for V2 measure. mc 2.6.19

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Not at all) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on FACT questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of partial agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of strong agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match NCIt. mc 9/8/20

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: Scoring and Interpretation materials are accessible after registration on the FACIT website.
